Intro.content: Today we want to create some conflict for our test subject.
We'll force them to fight for their survival.
They'll have no choice but to confront the "other"
And this will help to foster individuality in them.
For without the "other" there is no concept of self.
Without darkness, there can be no light.
We will prepare the island with 15 predators.
But we will only begin when everything is ready.
Firstly, the meek crab, which barely presents a challenge.
Secondly, the porcupine, a tougher opponent for sure.
Lastly, the wild boar, a formidable foe.
Now, place 15 of these and we can begin.

Main1 (After 15 placed).content: But the test subject will need a way to defend themselves.
Place either a stone or a stick.
Leave it further from the test subject to give an extra challenge.
Or closer to make things easier.

Complete - Easy.content: That was a bit too easy for the test subject I see.
A lack of conflict leads to a lack of purpose.

Complete - Hard.content: Well that was a tough challenge for the test subject.
Take care to create disorder, but not abject chaos.

Outro.content: Either way, our experiments are going well sp far.
